intro: Stenomesson acaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and narrow, often with a hairy texture. Stenomesson acaule is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
